value.name: Fresh Labour splits emerge over Sadiq Khan’s Brexit stance
value.description: Labour splits on Brexit have reopened as the party rejected Sadiq Khan’s call to allow young people to travel freely to and from the EU because it would drive up immigration. The London Mayor used a speech at the weekend to call for a youth mobility agreement with the European Union and said the UK should consider rejoining the customs union.

value.name: Newcastle United evening headlines with Magpies stance on Trippier and Wilson
value.description: Here are the latest Newcastle United headlines for Sunday, January 21, 2024. Newcastle United have rejected bids for both Kieran Trippier and Callum Wilson - but are braced for further interest on the pair. Bayern Munich made their moved on England full-back Trippier this weekend, with the Magpies rebuffing their bid.

value.name: Storm Isha: ScotRail trains suspended tonight and tomorrow
value.description: All trains in Scotland will be suspended from 7pm tonight as storm Isha hits across the country. ScotRail confirmed the move to passengers and said there will also be no trains on Monday morning due to the extreme weather. Due to safety concerns, Network Rail decided to close the railway to passenger services.

value.name: Brexit: Sadiq Khan attacks Labour’s ‘omerta’ silence over rejoining EU single market
value.description: London mayor Sadiq Khan has criticised the “omerta” which has prevented the party from debating whether the UK could re-join the EU single market after Brexit. The senior Labour figure suggested there was a code of silence which stopped Sir Keir Starmer ’s party discussing bolder steps to re-integrate with Brussels.

video.name: Keir Starmer says he would negotiate 'better' Brexit deal

value.name: Murder investigation launched after body of woman found near Gibraltar Point in Skegness
value.description: A murder investigation has been launched after a body of a woman was found near a coastal nature reserve. Detectives say the body of the woman, believed to be missing 23-year-old Petra Ross, was found near Gibraltar Point, Skegness, Lincolnshire. Ms Ross was reported missing on Friday 19 January.

value.name: Jeremy Hunt promises tax cuts as he cites Nigel Lawson
value.description: Jeremy Hunt has promised to cut more taxes as he compared his policies to those of Nigel Lawson’s efforts to boost the City of London in the 1980s.

value.name: Humza Yousaf invites Sir Keir Starmer for talks to establish 'working relationship'
value.description: Scotland's First Minister has invited Sir Keir Starmer for talks to establish a working relationship following an election, saying the Labour leader will "undoubtedly" be the next PM.

value.name: What every Labour Prime Minister got wrong
value.description: A Starmer government looks set to inherit the worst economic situation of any incoming government – of either party – since Clement Attlee in 1945. It should therefore worry today’s Labour supporters, given the dire economic inheritance, that the current policy offering looks dwarfed by the scale of the task.

value.name: Yousaf offers talks with 'next prime minister' Starmer
value.description: Scotland's First Minister Humza Yousaf has said he is "very willing" to work with the next Labour government if Sir Keir Starmer becomes prime minister. The SNP leader said he was "absolutely sure" that his party would win the most seats in Scotland - despite some polls putting them neck and neck with Labour.

value.name: Tories fearful of Canada ’93-style wipeout
value.description: A week of disastrous poll results has got many Tory MPs discussing the prospect of a Canada 1993-style wipeout at the next election, per Bloomberg. Research published on the front page of the Sunday Telegraph last week suggests Rishi Sunak’s party could hold on to as few as 169 seats as Sir Keir Starmer’s Labour enters Downing Street with 385 at the next election.

value.name: David Lammy's Speech Interrupted 5 Times By Pro-Palestinian Protesters
value.description: David Lammy was interrupted by five pro- Palestinian demonstrators while he was trying to give a speech on foreign policy on Saturday. The shadow foreign secretary was around 10 minutes into his address at the Fabian Society conference when the first sign of dissent popped up.

value.name: Rage and radicalism on Britain’s streets as thousands join actions for Palestine
value.description: As they marched, people chanted, “Ceasefire now,” and, “Shame on you Rishi Sunak,” “Shame on you Keir Starmer”. Hamza, a Palestinian, told the rally at the end of the march, “We must never lose hope. Every retweet, every post and protest helps.
